diseaseInfo.name: Melanocytic nevi
diseaseInfo.description: Common moles that are usually harmless.

diseaseInfo.name: Melanoma
diseaseInfo.description: A serious form of skin cancer that develops in melanocytes.

diseaseInfo.name: Benign keratosis-like lesions
diseaseInfo.description: Non-cancerous skin growths that resemble warts.

diseaseInfo.name: Basal cell carcinoma
diseaseInfo.description: A type of skin cancer that begins in basal cells.
diseaseInfo.treatment: Surgical excision, Mohs surgery, topical treatments.

diseaseInfo.name: Actinic keratoses
diseaseInfo.description: Rough, scaly patches caused by sun damage.

diseaseInfo.name: Dermatofibroma
diseaseInfo.description: Hard, raised growths that are usually benign.
diseaseInfo.treatment: Usually none, surgical removal if bothersome.
